programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: The inaugural golf league combines advanced technology with teams, which are made up of top PGA TOUR players from representing six different cities, facing off in a head-to-head competition; Los Angeles Golf Club takes on Jupiter Links GC in Week 2.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Miami (4-12, 0-5) dropped its last five games; No. 3 Duke (14-2, 6-0) won 10-straight games, and is 10-0 at home after an 86-78 win over Notre Dame behind an ACC freshman record 42 points from Cooper Flagg, who is third in the ACC with 19.1 ppg.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 25 Baylor (11-4, 3-1) won two straight after a 72-66 overtime win over Arizona State behind Norchad Omier; Arizona (10-5, 4-0) won six-straight games, and is 7-1 at home behind Caleb Love, who leads the Wildcats in scoring with 15.8 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 11 Texas A&M (13-3, 2-1) had its nine-game win streak ended by then-No. 5 Alabama, 94-88; No. 8 Kentucky (13-3, 2-1) is 10-0 at home, and is third in the country in scoring with 89.2 ppg behind Otega Oweh, who leads the team with 15.6 ppg.

programme.title: 2025 Australian Open
programme.desc: Jannik Sinner, Alexander Zverev, Carlos Alcaraz and Taylor Fritz are the top four seeds in the men's draw; Aryna Sabalenka, Iga Swiatek, Coco Gauff and Jasmine Paolini are the top-seeded women in the 128-player draw for the year's first major event.

programme.desc: No. 9 Kansas (12-3, 3-1) won its last three after a 54-40 win vs. Cincinnati; No. 2 Iowa State (14-1, 4-0) won 11 straight, and is 9-0 at home behind Curtis Jones, who is second in the Big 12 at 17.3 ppg, and Keshon Gilbert, who is fifth at 16.1 ppg.

programme.title: Latin America Amateur Championship Golf
programme.desc: Santiago de la Fuente became the first player from Mexico to win the event since 2019 after finishing at 10-under 270 for a two-stroke triumph over compatriot Omar Morales Nacif in last year's edition held at Santa Maria Golf Club in Panama City.

programme.title: College Gameday Podcast
programme.desc: Rece Davis and Pete Thamel break down the latest across the college football world, discussing recent news making headlines, recapping the previous weekend's games and look ahead to the upcoming slate of games, along with guest interviews.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 18 Memphis (13-3, 3-0) won four straight behind PJ Haggerty, who is top five in the country in scoring with 22.4 ppg, and won the last six meetings; Temple (10-6, 2-1) is 6-0 at home behind Jamal Mashburn Jr., who leads the Owls with 20.7 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova (11-6, 4-2) had a three-win streak snapped by St. John's, 80-68, despite Eric Dixon, who leads the country in scoring with 25.3 ppg; Xavier (10-7, 2-4) is 8-2 at home behind Zach Freemantle, who is top five in the Big East with 17.4 ppg.

programme.desc: Providence (9-8, 3-3) won its last two games, and won three of the last four meetings after a 78-73 win in the 2024 Big East Tournament; Creighton (10-6, 3-2) is 8-1 at home behind Ryan Kalkbrenner, who is third in the Big East with 17.7 ppg.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Defending champion Paris Saint-Germain, a 15-time winner of the tournament, has won nine of its 10 previous contests in the competition; Espaly-Saint-Marcel advanced past Dijon in the Round of 64 with a 4-3 shootout victory at home on Dec. 20.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Marquette claimed victories over Seton Hall in both of their meetings from the 2023-24 season, winning the final matchup on Feb. 20 with a 68-62 score; Liza Karlen posted 23 points and 10 rebounds for the Golden Eagles in the win at home.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: The National Football League presents a closer, documentary-style look at the teams and towns featured prominently each Sunday in the league, as well as a look at the most enigmatic personalities of the league and the impressive plays of the weekend.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Big Noon Kickoff
programme.desc: The FOX Big Noon Kickoff crew goes on the road different campuses across the country and discusses the biggest games of the weekend, while evaluating player performances; experts weigh in on trending topics and teams throughout the nation.

programme.title: FS1 College Hoops Extra
programme.desc: Hosts and analysts provide the latest highlights and scores to games in college basketball from around the country, providing analysis on the games that have concluded and going on, along with a preview of the upcoming matchups.

programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Each bowler in the eight-player field will have two minutes to throw as many strikes as possible with the player with the most strikes advancing to the next round; Akron's Chris Via, the No. 1 seed, is the defending champion; winner receives $30,000.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Providence (9-8, 3-3) won its last two games, and won three of the last four meetings after a 78-73 win in the 2024 Big East Tournament; Creighton (10-6, 3-2) is 8-1 at home behind Ryan Kalkbrenner, who is third in the Big East with 17.7 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa (12-4, 3-2) won five of its last six games, and is second in the country in scoring with 89.6 ppg behind Payton Sandfort, who leads the team with 16.9 ppg; USC (10-6, 2-3) comes off an 82-72 win over then-No. 13 Illinois, and is 8-3 at home.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Defending champion Paris Saint-Germain, a 15-time winner of the tournament, has won nine of its 10 previous contests in the competition; Espaly-Saint-Marcel advanced past Dijon in the Round of 64 with a 4-3 shootout victory at home on Dec. 20.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova (11-6, 4-2) had a three-win streak snapped by St. John's, 80-68, despite Eric Dixon, who leads the country in scoring with 25.3 ppg; Xavier (10-7, 2-4) is 8-2 at home behind Zach Freemantle, who is top five in the Big East with 17.4 ppg.

programme.title: NHRA Sportsman Series
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in different classifications; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various drag-racing classes.

programme.title: Coupe de France

programme.title: The Auto Show
programme.desc: An all-access look at some of the biggest car trade shows from across the country showcase some of the finest cars and trucks on the floor, the latest concepts and technologies from top companies and the newest products on the market.

programme.title: Magnify
programme.desc: The disappearance of quarterback Tom Brady's jersey after leading the New England Patriots' epic comeback to beat the Atlanta Falcons in Super Bowl LI is chronicled, which includes exclusive conversations with Brady and the man who stole the jersey.

programme.title: Magnify
programme.desc: The cultural importance of sports is examined through the exploration of various athletes' journeys through life, both on and off the field, including the challenges, change and unity that sports are able to bring to different communities.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Monaco defeated Union Saint-Jean in the Round of 64, 4-1; Reims is unbeaten in three of the four previous meetings with Les Rouge et Blanc across all competitions after the two sides played to a scoreless draw in a Ligue 1 contest on Dec. 14.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: No. 24 Illinois (3-0) stayed unbeaten with a 30-9 win over Central Michigan behind twp TDs from Pat Bryant; No. 22 Nebraska (3-0) is outscoring its opponents, 102-20, and beat Illinois last year, 20-7, after losing the previous three meetings.

programme.title: College Football
